error.signature: Warning: Cache not found for input keys: node-linux-x64-abc123
error.regex: (?:Cache not found for input keys|cache miss|Cache entry not found|No cache found)

verdict.summary: GitHub Actions cache action fails to restore a cache because the key does not match any existing cache entry. Leads to slower builds as dependencies must be downloaded and built from scratch.

dead_ends.action: Use an overly specific cache key that includes commit SHA
dead_ends.why_fails: Every commit generates a unique key, so the cache is never reused and always misses

dead_ends.action: Manually delete and recreate caches from the GitHub UI repeatedly
dead_ends.why_fails: Does not address the key generation strategy; caches will continue to miss if keys are not properly configured

workarounds.action: Use hashFiles() on lockfiles for cache keys with fallback restore-keys
workarounds.how: Set key to something like 'node-${{ runner.os }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}' and add restore-keys with progressively less specific prefixes like 'node-${{ runner.os }}-'

workarounds.action: Switch to the built-in caching in setup-node, setup-python, or similar setup actions
workarounds.how: Use 'cache: npm' in actions/setup-node or 'cache: pip' in actions/setup-python instead of manual cache action configuration

leads_to.condition: When cache miss causes full dependency rebuild, pushing the job over its time limit

preceded_by.condition: When lockfile changes invalidate the previous cache key

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Cache miss means dependency cache was not restored; artifact not found means build output from a prior job is missing
